semaphore

Class LocalSemaphore

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.concurrent.Semaphore
      • semaphore.LocalSemaphore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, SemaphoreInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Semaphore

    public class LocalSemaphore
extends java.util.concurrent.Semaphore
implements SemaphoreInterface
    A wrapper for Java's Semaphore class, effectively renaming java.util.semaphore's acquire() and release() methods to match the poll() and vote() methods from the lecture.
    Version:
    January 2020
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      A semaphore with no (explict) upper limit.

      • name

        private java.lang.String name
        This semaphore's name.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LocalSemaphore

        public LocalSemaphore(java.lang.String name,
                      int initialValue,
                      int limit)
        A generic constructor, with a limit value for bounded semaphores. For unbounded semaphores, such as this one, the limit parameter is ignored.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this semaphore
        initialValue - the initial value for this semaphore
        limit - limit value for the semaphore (ignored, as this type of semaphore has no upper limit)

      • LocalSemaphore

        public LocalSemaphore(java.lang.String name,
                      int initialValue)
        A semaphore with no (explict) upper limit.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this semaphore
        initialValue - the initial value for this semaphore

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of this semaphore.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface SemaphoreInterface
        Returns:
        the name of this semaphore

      • poll

        public void poll()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Acquire this semaphore. If the current thread:
        • has its interrupted status set on entry to this method; or
        • is interrupted while waiting for a permit,
        then InterruptedException is thrown and the current thread's interrupted status is cleared.
        Specified by:
        poll in interface SemaphoreInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.

      • vote

        public void vote()
          throws SemaphoreError
        Release this semaphore.
        Specified by:
        vote in interface SemaphoreInterface
        Throws:
        SemaphoreError - (shouldn't happen: this should only happen for crashing bounded semaphores, where increasing the semaphore's value would take it beyond the semaphore's maximum permitted value.
